math_problem.A3565:
Determine all polynomials $P(x)$ with real coefficients such that
$P(x)^2 + P\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)^2=  P(x^2)P\left(\frac{1}{x^2}\right)$ for all $x$. Instead of determining all polynomials satisfying the functional equation, simply find $k = P(1) + 3$, where $P(1)$ is the value of any such polynomial at $x=1$ derived from substituting $x=1$ into the equation.

math_problem.A1621: Compute the positive real number $x$ satisfying $x^{\left(2 x^{6}\right)}=3$

A1621: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Algebra -> Equations and Inequalities
